Steam (ST): The Ushiromiya family members were relaxing here and there around the waiting room.
Umineko Project (UP): The Ushiromiya family members were relaxing here and there around the waiting room.
PC Japanese (JP): 控え室には、右代宮家の親族たちがそれぞれに寛いでいた。
Russian (RU): Члены семьи Уширомия отдыхали в зале ожидания.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Os membros da família Ushiromiya estavam relaxando cada um no seu canto.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 等候室中，右代宮家的親族們正在各自放鬆休息。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 等候室中，右代宫家的亲族们正在各自放松休息。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): I membri della famiglia Ushiromiya si stavano rilassando in giro per la sala d'attesa.

Steam (ST): A light buffet-style meal had been set up, but it was a bit stale, and not particularly appealing.
Umineko Project (UP): A light buffet‐style meal had been set up, but it looked a bit stale and not particularly appetizing.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): A light buffet-style meal had been set up, but it was a bit stale, and not particularly appealing.
PC Japanese (JP): バイキング形式の軽食が準備されているが、少し干からびていて、食欲はそそらない。
Russian (RU): Был накрыт лёгкий шведский стол, но уже не такой свежий и не особо привлекательный.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mesmo com um bufê livre à disposição, ele parecia um pouco rançoso e não despertava muito o apetite.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖備著一些自取形式的小點心，但因為已略微有點發乾，所以勾不起人的食欲。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽备着一些自取形式的小点心，但因为已略微有点发干，所以勾不起人的食欲。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Era stato allestito un piccolo buffet, ma non era particolarmente attraente.

Steam (ST): Even so, those voracious kids seemed to find it intensely interesting.
Umineko Project (UP): Even so, those voracious kids seemed to find it intensely appealing.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Even so, those voracious kids seemed to find it intensely interesting.
PC Japanese (JP): それでも、食欲旺盛な子供たちには魅力的らしい。
Russian (RU): Однако прожорливым детям он всё равно понравился больше всего.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ainda assim, as vorazes crianças pareciam achá‐lo intensamente atrativo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過即便如此，對食欲旺盛的小孩們來說，它們好像仍很有吸引力。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过即便如此，对食欲旺盛的小孩们来说，它们好像仍很有吸引力。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Nonostante ciò, quei voraci ragazzini lo trovavano particolarmente interessante.

Steam (ST): The cousins had set up camp around it, with Maria at the center. The adult siblings had also formed a group in a different corner.
Umineko Project (UP): The cousins had set up camp around it, with Maria at the center.{n}The adult siblings had also formed a group in a different corner.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The cousins had set up camp around it, with Maria at the center. The adult siblings had also formed a group in a different corner.
PC Japanese (JP): 真里亞を中心に、いとこ勢がそこで車座になっている。親兄弟たちも、別の一角で車座になっている。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 真里亞を中心に、いとこ勢がそこで車座になっている。{n}親兄弟たちも、別の一角で車座になっている。
Russian (RU): Кузены расселись вокруг него с Марией в центре.{n}Взрослые родственники тоже образовали группу в другом углу.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Os primos se amontoaram em seu entorno, com Maria ao centro.{n}Os irmãos formaram um grupo em um canto oposto.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 以真里亞為中心，堂兄妹們圍坐在小點心的旁邊。{n}而各位長輩則圍坐在另一角。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 以真里亚为中心，堂兄妹们围坐在小点心的旁边。{n}而各位长辈则围坐在另一角。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): I cugini vi si erano piazzati intorno, con Maria al centro. Anche gli adulti avevano formato un gruppo in un altro angolo.

Steam (ST): Perhaps because of Kinzo's absence, everyone seemed to be a little more relaxed.
Umineko Project (UP): Perhaps because of Kinzo's absence, everyone seemed to be a little more relaxed.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Perhaps because of Kinzo's absence, everyone seemed to be a little more relaxed.
PC Japanese (JP): 金蔵の姿がないこともあってか、わずかにではあるが、弛緩した雰囲気だった。
Russian (RU): Быть может, из‐за отсутствия Кинзо, все выглядели чуть более расслабленными.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Talvez, dada a ausência de Kinzo, todos pareciam um pouco mais relaxados.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 大概是有金藏不在的原因吧，雖只談得上“略微”，但此處可謂氣氛輕鬆。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 大概是有金藏不在的原因吧，虽只谈得上“略微”，但此处可谓气氛轻松。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Sembravano tutti un po' più tranquilli, forse a causa dell'assenza di Kinzo.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Natsuhi
Steam (ST): "...Lion, where did you go? ...And who is that?"
Umineko Project (UP): "......Lion. Where did you go? ......And who is that?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「……理御。どこへ行っていたのですか？　……そちらの方は。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……理御。どこへ行っていたのですか？　……そちらの方は」
Russian (RU): "......Лион. Где тебя носило?......А это кто?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Lion. Onde você estava? ......E quem seria esse?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……理御。剛才去哪了？……這位是？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……理御。刚才去哪了？……这位是？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Lion. Dov'eri? ... E chi è lui?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Lion
Steam (ST): "Mother, I was entertaining this guest of ours. Will, this is my mother, Natsuhi."
Umineko Project (UP): "Mother, I was entertaining this guest of ours. Will, this is my mother, Natsuhi."
PC Japanese (JP): 「母さん。お客様のお相手をしていました。ウィル、こちらは母の夏妃です。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「母さん。お客様のお相手をしていました。ウィル、こちらは母の夏妃です」
Russian (RU): "Мама... Кто‐то же должен был занять нашего гостя. Уилл, это моя мама, Нацухи."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Mãe, eu estava fazendo sala para nosso convidado. Will, esta é a minha mãe, Natsuhi."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「媽媽。我剛才在陪客人。威爾，這位是家母夏妃。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「妈妈。我刚才在陪客人。威尔，这位是家母夏妃。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Madre, stavo intrattenendo questo nostro ospite. Will, mia Madre, Natsuhi."

Speaker: Willard H. Wright
Steam (ST): "No introductions needed. Just tell me what you have to say."
Umineko Project (UP): "No introductions needed. I just need to hear what she has to say."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "No introductions needed. Just let me hear what you have to say."
PC Japanese (JP): 「紹介はいらねェ。ただ、話を聞かせてくれりゃいい。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「紹介はいらねェ。ただ、話を聞かせてくれりゃいい」
Russian (RU): "Представляться не обязательно. Просто пусть выскажет своё слово."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Não precisa apresentar. Só preciso ouvir o que ela tem a dizer."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「不用介紹。只需提供口供就行了。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「不用介绍。只需提供口供就行了。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Non c'è bisogno di presentazioni. Fammi solo sentire che hai da dire."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Natsuhi
Steam (ST): "Huh? Did you say something?"
Umineko Project (UP): "Huh? Did you say something?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「え？　何か仰いまして？」
Russian (RU): "Э? Вы что‐то сказали?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Quê? Disse alguma coisa?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「哎？您說什麼？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「哎？您说什么？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Uh? Hai detto qualcosa?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Lion
Steam (ST): "No, he said nothing. This is Will-san. It seems he knew the deceased."
Umineko Project (UP): "No, he said nothing. This is Will‐san. It seems he knew the deceased."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "No, he said nothing. This is Will-san. It seems he knew the deceased."
PC Japanese (JP): 「いいえ、何も。こちらはウィルさん。故人に縁ある方だそうです。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「いいえ、何も。こちらはウィルさん。故人に縁ある方だそうです」
Russian (RU): "Нет, ничего. Это Уилл. Он знал покойную."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Não, ele não disse nada. Este é o Will‐san. Parece ser um velho conhecido da falecida."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「不，他沒說什麼。這位是威爾先生。好像跟故人曾有淵源。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「不，他没说什么。这位是威尔先生。好像跟故人曾有渊源。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "No, non ha detto nulla. Lui è Will-san. Sembra che conoscesse la defunta."

Steam (ST): With a smile, Lion casually smoothed over Will's words.
Umineko Project (UP): With a smile, Lion casually smoothed over Will's words.
PC Japanese (JP): 理御は笑顔でさらりと、ウィルの暴言を流させる。
Russian (RU): Лион беспечно и с улыбкой сглаживает слова Уилла.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Com um sorriso, Lion casualmente aliviou as palavras de Will.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 理御一臉笑容，輕描淡寫地就把威爾沒禮貌的話給化解了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 理御一脸笑容，轻描淡写地就把威尔没礼貌的话给化解了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Sorridendo, Lion coprì le parole di Will con noncuranza.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Lion
Steam (ST): "He wants to know more about Beatrice. ...Do you know anything about her, Mother?"
Umineko Project (UP): "He wants to know more about Beatrice. ......Do you know anything about her, Mother?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「彼は、ベアトリーチェのことを、より詳しく知りたがっています。……母さんは、ベアトリーチェについては、何かご存知ですか？」
Russian (RU): "Он хочет больше узнать о Беатриче. ......Ты что‐нибудь о ней знаешь, мама?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Ele queria saber mais sobre a Beatrice. ......Você sabe algo sobre ela, mãe?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「他想更進一步地了解一下貝阿朵莉切的事。……請問媽媽，對貝阿朵莉切是否知道些什麼？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「他想更进一步地了解一下贝阿朵莉切的事。……请问妈妈，对贝阿朵莉切是否知道些什么？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Vorrebbe sapere di più su Beatrice. ... Sai niente su di lei, Madre?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Natsuhi
Steam (ST): "...... ...Lion, the departed is an individual to whom the Head owed a great debt. Nothing more, nothing less. This funeral is a ceremony for the Head to repay his benefactor for all he received while that person still lived. That is what I have been told, and there is nothing more to it than that."
Umineko Project (UP): "........................ ......Lion. The deceased is a woman to whom the head once owed a great debt. Nothing more, nothing less. This funeral is a ceremony for the head to repay the debts he made to her while she was alive. That is what I have heard, and there is nothing more to it than that."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "...............Lion. The deceased is a woman to whom the Head owed a great debt. Nothing more, nothing less. This funeral is a ceremony for the Head to repay the debts he made to her while she was alive. That is what I have heard, so there is nothing more to it than that."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……………………。……理御。故人は、当主様のかつての恩人です。そして、それ以上でもそれ以下の関係でもありません。この葬儀は、当主様が故人への生前の恩を報いるためのお式。そう聞いていますし、それ以外のことは何もありません。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……………………。……理御。故人は、当主様のかつての恩人です。そして、それ以上でもそれ以下の関係でもありません。この葬儀は、当主様が故人への生前の恩を報いるためのお式。そう聞いていますし、それ以外のことは何もありません」
Russian (RU): "...............Лион. Покойная была благодетельницей главы. Ни больше, ни меньше. Эти похороны — ритуал, на котором глава возвращает ей должное при её жизни. Это всё, что я слышала, и больше нечего добавить."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "........................ ......Lion. A falecida é uma mulher para quem o chefe possuía um grande débito. Nada mais, nada menos. Este funeral é uma cerimônia para o chefe pagar a dívida que fez com ela quando a mesma ainda estava viva. Foi isso o que eu ouvi e não há nada mais além."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……………………。……理御。故人，是當主大人往昔的恩人。並且，他們僅僅有著這種關係。這場葬禮，是當主大人報答故人生前所施之恩的儀式。我聽說的就是這樣，除此之外就沒別的了。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……………………。……理御。故人，是当主大人往昔的恩人。并且，他们仅仅有着这种关系。这场葬礼，是当主大人报答故人生前所施之恩的仪式。我听说的就是这样，除此之外就没别的了。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Lion. La defunta è una donna con cui il capofamiglia ha un gran debito. Niente di più, niente di meno. Questo funerale è una cerimonia che il capofamiglia ha allestito per ripagare il debito che aveva con lei mentre era in vita. Questo è ciò che ho sentito, quindi non c'è altro."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Lion
Steam (ST): "...Thanks, Mother. Will, that's all my mother knows."
Umineko Project (UP): "......Thanks, Mother. Will, that's all my mother knows."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……ありがとう、母さん。ウィル、母が知っていることはこれだけです。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……ありがとう、母さん。ウィル、母が知っていることはこれだけです」
Russian (RU): "......Спасибо, мама. Уилл, это всё, что известно моей матери."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Eu agradeço, mãe. Will, isso é tudo o que a minha mãe sabe."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……謝謝，媽媽。威爾，家母所知的，就只有這些。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……谢谢，妈妈。威尔，家母所知的，就只有这些。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Grazie, Madre. Will, questo è tutto ciò che mia Madre conosce."

Steam (ST): Natsuhi was eager to deny the scandal about Beatrice being Kinzo's mistress.
Umineko Project (UP): Natsuhi was very resistant to the scandalous rumors that Kinzo, a man she greatly respected, had once had a concubine called Beatrice.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Natsuhi completely denied the scandal about Beatrice being Kinzo's mistress.
PC Japanese (JP): 夏妃は、尊敬する金蔵にベアトリーチェという妾がいたという醜聞に対し、とても否定的だ。
Russian (RU): Нацухи отвергла скандал о том, что {f:5:Беатриче} была любовницей Кинзо.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Natsuhi era bem resistente em relação aos rumores escandalosos sobre Kinzo, um homem que ela respeitava muito e que certa vez teve uma concubina chamada Beatrice.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 夏妃對自己所尊敬的金藏“有個叫貝阿朵莉切的小妾”的醜聞持否定態度。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 夏妃对自己所尊敬的金藏“有个叫贝阿朵莉切的小妾”的丑闻持否定态度。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Natsuhi aveva negato completamente lo scandalo riguardo Beatrice come amante di Kinzo.

Steam (ST): However, she also had enough sense to realize that this scandal was probably true.
Umineko Project (UP): However, she also understood that the scandal was probably the truth.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, she also had enough sense to realize that the scandal was probably the truth.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、その醜聞は恐らく事実だろうとも理解している。
Russian (RU): Однако при этом она достаточно хорошо понимала, что такое возможно.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Porém, ela também sabia que esse escândalo provavelmente era verdade.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過與此同時，她也明白，這個醜聞恐怕是事實。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过与此同时，她也明白，这个丑闻恐怕是事实。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Tuttavia, aveva abbastanza buonsenso da capire che ciò era probabilmente vero.

Steam (ST): Picking up that Natsuhi was in a bad mood and didn't want to talk about this anymore, Lion brought an end to that conversation before Will could say something rude again.
Umineko Project (UP): Picking up that Natsuhi was in a bad mood and didn't want to talk about this anymore, Lion brought an end to that conversation before Will could say something rude again.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Picking up that Natsuhi was in a bad mood and didn't want to talk about this anymore, Lion brought an end to that conversation before Will could say something rude again.
PC Japanese (JP): それ以上、この話をしたくないという母の不機嫌を敏感に感じ取り、ウィルが次なる暴言を口にしない内に、話を綺麗にまとめて切り上げた。
Russian (RU): Нацухи была в плохом настроении и больше не хотела об этом говорить, поэтому пришлось положить конец этому разговору до того, как Уилл опять скажет нечто грубое.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Percebendo que Natsuhi não estava de bom humor e não queria mais tocar no assunto, Lion encerrou a conversa antes que Will pudesse dizer algo rude.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 敏感地感到，代表著“不想再繼續說下去了”的媽媽的那份不快，理御趕緊在威爾講出下句無禮之言前，漂亮地總結話題，為其畫上了句號。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 敏感地感到，代表着“不想再继续说下去了”的妈妈的那份不快，理御赶紧在威尔讲出下句无礼之言前，漂亮地总结话题，为其画上了句号。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Capendo che Natsuhi era di cattivo umore e non voleva parlare più di questo argomento, Lion pose fine alla conversazione prima che Will potesse dire di nuovo qualcosa di sgarbato.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Lion
Steam (ST): "Will, this chapel belongs to the family."
Umineko Project (UP): "Will. This chapel is the property of our family."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Will. This chapel belongs to the family."
PC Japanese (JP): 「ウィル。この礼拝堂は、当家の敷地内です。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「ウィル。この礼拝堂は、当家の敷地内です」
Russian (RU): "Уилл. Эта часовня принадлежит семье."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Will. Esta capela é propriedade da nossa família."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「威爾。這個禮拜堂，可是在本宅的領地之內。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「威尔。这个礼拜堂，可是在本宅的领地之内。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Will. Questa cappella appartiene alla famiglia."

Speaker: Willard H. Wright
Steam (ST): "So you're telling me to follow the family's rules?"
Umineko Project (UP): "So you're telling me to follow the family's rules?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「当家のルールに従えってか。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「当家のルールに従えってか」
Russian (RU): "Ты к тому, что мне нужно следовать семейным правилам?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Está me dizendo para seguir as regras da família?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「是叫我遵守你府上的規矩嘛？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「是叫我遵守你府上的规矩嘛？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Quindi mi stai dicendo di attenermi alle regole di famiglia?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Lion
Steam (ST): "Speak in a manner appropriate for a guest of the family. Let me be the medium for all of your conversations. I ask that you follow those two rules."
Umineko Project (UP): "You'll speak in a manner appropriate for a guest of the family. And you'll conduct all of your conversations through me. I must ask that you follow those two rules."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Speak in a manner appropriate for a guest of the family. Let me be the medium for all of your conversations. I ask that you follow those two rules."
PC Japanese (JP): 「当家の客人に相応しい口調に改めていただく。話は全て私を介していただく。その２つを守っていただけるよう、お願い致します。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「当家の客人に相応しい口調に改めていただく。話は全て私を介していただく。その２つを守っていただけるよう、お願い致します」
Russian (RU): "Говори как полагается гостю семьи. И позволь мне быть посредником во всех твоих разговорах. Я прошу тебя следовать двум этим правилам."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Você deve falar de maneira apropriada a um convidado da família. Irei intermediar todas as suas conversas. Devo pedir que siga essas duas regras."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「請您改用相稱於我家客人的措詞口吻。所有要問的事，都請交由我來當中介。拜託您，守好這兩條規矩。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「请您改用相称于我家客人的措词口吻。所有要问的事，都请交由我来当中介。拜托您，守好这两条规矩。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Parla in maniera appropriata a un ospite della famiglia. Lascia che ti faccia da mediatore per le tue conversazioni. Ti chiedo di seguire queste due regole."

Speaker: Willard H. Wright
Steam (ST): "I'll work on that."
Umineko Project (UP): "I'll work on that."
PC Japanese (JP): 「努力すらァ。」
Russian (RU): "Постараюсь."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Vou me esforçar."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「我盡力吧。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「我尽力吧。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Ci proverò."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Lion
Steam (ST): "...The mess this {f:5:Bernkastel} witch or whatever has dragged us into is a real pain. Because of that, I'm willing to help you. But we're equal partners in this job, and you'd best not forget that."

Steam (ST): "If I hadn't taken her out with me, she never would have died...! She was so innocent, like a chick. I took her out, and she just followed along obediently! She stayed right behind me, trusting me completely...! And because I made her take such a dangerous path...!!"

Russian (RU): "Если бы я не вывела её, она бы не умерла!.. Она была такой невинной, как цыплёнок. Я вывела её, и она просто послушно шла следом! Она шла за мной, ни в чём меня не подозревая!.. И из‐за того что я заставила её пойти по такой опасной дороге..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Se eu não tivesse tirado ela de lá, ela nunca teria morrido...! Ela era muito pura, como uma menininha. Eu a tirei de lá, e ela me seguiu obedientemente o tempo todo! Ela permaneceu indo atrás de mim, confiando totalmente em mim...! E, por eu ter feito ela passar por um caminho tão perigoso...!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「我要是沒帶她出來，她就不用死了…！她是個純真無垢，像只小雞般的人。我一帶她出來，她就老老實實地跟來了！沒有任何懷疑，緊緊地跟在我身後…！都怪我，叫她從那種腳下懸乎的地方走…！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「我要是没带她出来，她就不用死了…！她是个纯真无垢，像只小鸡般的人。我一带她出来，她就老老实实地跟来了！没有任何怀疑，紧紧地跟在我身后…！都怪我，叫她从那种脚下悬乎的地方走…！！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Se non l'avessi portata fuori, non sarebbe mai morta...! Era così innocente, come un pulcino. L'ho portata all'esterno, quindi mi ha semplicemente obbedito seguendomi! Stava proprio dietro di me, fidandosi ciecamente...! E poiché le ho fatto prendere una strada così pericolosa...!!"

Russian (RU): "У меня не было такого намерения! Я просто подумала, что ей бы захотелось увидеть океан!.. Нет, просто по той дороге было тяжело идти, и я посчитала, что проще сначала спуститься со скалы!.."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Eu nunca quis fazer aquilo! Eu só pensei que ela gostaria de ver o mar...! Não, pareceu que o caminho seria complicado de se caminhar, por isso pensei que seria mais fácil cortarmos caminho descendo pela falésia...!!"

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「我没这种想法！只是想到，她想看海…！不对，我是看她走得挺辛苦的，所以想到，爬到下面去，会不会稍微好走点…！！」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rudolf
Steam (ST): "Beatrice is supposed to be that lady of leisure who lent Dad all that gold shortly after the war, right?"
Umineko Project (UP): "Beatrice is supposed to be that lady of leisure who lent Dad all that gold shortly after the war, right?"

Russian (RU): "Беатриче — это та мадам, которая одолжила отцу золото вскоре после войны, верно?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Beatrice supostamente seria a esposa burguesa que emprestou ao pai o ouro logo depois da guerra, certo?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「叫貝阿朵莉切的女人，應該是戰後不久貸給爸黃金的閑著沒事幹的闊太太吧？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「叫贝阿朵莉切的女人，应该是战后不久贷给爸黄金的闲着没事干的阔太太吧？」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Hideyoshi
Steam (ST): "By usin' Beatrice's gold as a foundation, Father revived the Ushiromiya family and got super rich. Then he bought Rokkenjima and moved over. Rosa-san meetin' her must've been at least 10 years after that."
Umineko Project (UP): "Usin' Beatrice's gold as a foundation, Father revived the Ushiromiya family and got super rich. Then he bought Rokkenjima and moved over. Rosa‐san's meetin' must have been at least ten years after that."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "By using Beatrice's gold as a foundation, Father revived the Ushiromiya family and got super rich. Then he bought Rokkenjima and moved over. Rosa-san's meeting must have been at least 10 years after that."
PC Japanese (JP): 「お父さんはベアトリーチェの黄金を元手に、右代宮家を復興して大金持ちになり。そして六軒島を買い取り移住するんや。楼座さんが出会ったのは、それから１０年以上も先の話になるで。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「お父さんはベアトリーチェの黄金を元手に、右代宮家を復興して大金持ちになり。そして六軒島を買い取り移住するんや。楼座さんが出会ったのは、それから１０年以上も先の話になるで」
Russian (RU): "Вложив в основу золото Беатриче, отец возродил семью Уширомия и разбогател. Затем он купил Роккенджиму и переехал. Роза должна была встретить её как минимум 10 лет спустя."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Usando o ouro da Beatrice como capital, o pai reviveu a família Ushiromiya e ficou super‐rico. Então comprou Rokkenjima e se mudou para cá. O encontro da Rosa‐san deve ter sido, no mínimo, uns dez anos depois disso."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「爸以貝阿朵莉切的黃金為本錢，復興了右代宮家，成為了大富豪。然後買下並移居到了六軒島。這可是在樓座妹子遇見她的，十多年以前的事吶。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「爸以贝阿朵莉切的黄金为本钱，复兴了右代宫家，成为了大富豪。然后买下并移居到了六轩岛。这可是在楼座妹子遇见她的，十多年以前的事呐。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Usando l'oro di Beatrice come garanzia, nostro Padre ricostruì la famiglia Ushiromiya diventando ricchissimo. Quindi comprò Rokkenjima e vi si trasferì. L'incontro di Rosa-san deve essere avvenuto almeno 10 anni dopo."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Eva
Steam (ST): "A woman who could do as she pleased with 10 tons of gold could hardly be some little girl. And 10 more years passed before she met Rosa. ...Rosa, about how old did the Beatrice you met look?"
Umineko Project (UP): "A woman with free control over ten tons of gold could hardly be some little girl. And ten more years passed after that before she met Rosa. ...Rosa, about how old did the Beatrice you met look?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "A woman who could do as she pleased with 10 tons of gold could hardly be some little girl. And 10 more years passed before she met Rosa. ...Rosa. About how old did the Beatrice you met look?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「１０ｔの黄金を自在に出来るご夫人が、小娘程度のわけはない。ましてや、楼座が会った頃には、それからさらに１０年以上が経過してる。…楼座。あんたの会ったベアトリーチェはいくつくらいに見えたのよ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「１０ｔの黄金を自在に出来るご夫人が、小娘程度のわけはない。ましてや、楼座が会った頃には、それからさらに１０年以上が経過してる。…楼座。あんたの会ったベアトリーチェはいくつくらいに見えたのよ」
Russian (RU): "Та, кто могла свободно распоряжаться 10 тоннами золота, вряд ли была маленькой девочкой. И перед её встречей с Розой прошло более 10 лет. ...Роза. Сколько лет на вид было Беатриче, которую ты встретила?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Uma mulher que tinha livre controle sobre dez toneladas de ouro dificilmente seria uma garotinha. E se passaram mais dez anos depois do encontro da Rosa. ...Rosa, quantos anos aquela Beatrice aparentava ter?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「能自由動用 10 吨黃金的貴婦，不可能是個小姑娘。更何況，在樓座遇到她時，可是距借黃金時又過了十多年。…樓座。你遇見的貝阿朵莉切，看起來大約幾歲？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「能自由动用 10 吨黄金的贵妇，不可能是个小姑娘。更何况，在楼座遇到她时，可是距借黄金时又过了十多年。…楼座。你遇见的贝阿朵莉切，看起来大约几岁？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Una donna che va in giro con 10 tonnellate d'oro difficilmente può essere una ragazzina. E passarono altri 10 anni prima di incontrare Rosa. ... Rosa. Quanti anni dimostrava la Beatrice che incontrasti?"

Russian (RU): "......Она выглядела старше, чем я тогда...... но всё равно было похоже, что она только достигала совершеннолетия. Да, того же возраста, что и Беатриче на портрете."

Speaker: Willard H. Wright
Steam (ST): "Unless Ushiromiya Kinzo tells us what really happened, we won't get any further than this. Don't tell me that arguing with Kinzo and persuading him to spill the beans is supposed to be part of this game."
Umineko Project (UP): "Unless Ushiromiya Kinzo tells us what really happened, we won't get any further than this. Don't tell me that sweet‐talking Kinzo into spilling the beans...is all part and parcel of this game."

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "A não ser que Ushiromiya Kinzo conte o que realmente aconteceu, nós não iremos muito longe nisso. Não me diga que persuadir Kinzo para fazer ele colocar tudo pra fora...também é parte deste jogo."

Speaker: Willard H. Wright
Steam (ST): "...Furudo Erika's reasoning was probably correct. It started out as a legend of evil spirits on Rokkenjima. Later on, elements such as Kinzo's occult hobbies, the name and portrait of the mysterious woman, Beatrice, and the epitaph got mixed in, and it was all integrated into the Legend of the Golden Witch."
Umineko Project (UP): "......Furudo Erika's reasoning was probably correct. It started out as the legend of the evil spirits on Rokkenjima. Later on, elements such as Kinzo's occult hobbies, the name and portrait of the mysterious woman "Beatrice", and the epitaph got mixed in, and it all fused into the legend of the Golden Witch."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......Furudo Erika's reasoning was probably correct. It started out as the legend of the evil spirits on Rokkenjima. Later on, elements such as Kinzo's occult hobbies, the name and portrait of the mysterious woman, Beatrice, and the epitaph got mixed in, and it was all integrated into the legend of the Golden Witch."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……古戸ヱリカの推理は正しいだろう。元々、六軒島に存在した悪霊の伝説。そこに金蔵のオカルト趣味と謎の女、ベアトリーチェの名前や肖像画、碑文が次第に加味されていき、黄金の魔女伝説に統合された。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……古戸ヱリカの推理は正しいだろう。元々、六軒島に存在した悪霊の伝説。そこに金蔵のオカルト趣味と謎の女、ベアトリーチェの名前や肖像画、碑文が次第に加味されていき、黄金の魔女伝説に統合された」
Russian (RU): "......Возможно, Фурудо Эрика была права. Всё началось с легенды о злых духах Роккенджимы. Потом элементы вроде оккультных хобби Кинзо, имя и портрет таинственной женщины — 'Беатриче' — и эпитафия смешались с этим, и всё это превратилось в легенду о Золотой ведьме."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......O raciocínio de Furudo Erika provavelmente estava certo. Começou com a lenda dos espíritos malignos de Rokkenjima. Mais tarde, elementos como os hobbies ocultistas de Kinzo, o nome e o retrato de uma mulher misteriosa chamada "Beatrice", e com o epitáfio sendo misturado no meio, tudo isso se fundiu na Lenda da Bruxa Dourada."

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A expressão de Will permaneceu inalterada o tempo inteiro.{n}O rosto de Shannon permanecia gentil e caloroso.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 威爾的臉，從一開始起就沒有過任何動容。{n}而紗音的臉也保持著，溫柔、恬靜。

Steam (ST): And yet, the tension was as icy as a frozen lake...
Umineko Project (UP): And yet, the tension was as icy as a frozen lake...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And yet, the tension was as icy as a frozen lake...
PC Japanese (JP): なのに、緊張感が、凍結した湖面のように張り詰める…。
Russian (RU): И всё же, напряжённость была ледяная, как замёрзшее озеро...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mesmo assim, a tensão era gélida, como um lago congelado...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 可儘管如此，緊張感卻緊繃得就像凍住了的湖面…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 可尽管如此，紧张感却紧绷得就像冻住了的湖面…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Eppure, c'era una tensione gelida come un lago ghiacciato...

Steam (ST): ...Beginners in chess will sometimes move their king into check without noticing it.
Umineko Project (UP): ......Beginners in chess will sometimes move their king into check without noticing.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Beginners in chess will sometimes move their king into check without noticing it.
PC Japanese (JP): ……チェスの初心者は時に、不注意にも、相手の射線に気付かずに、そこへキングを動かしてしまうことがある。
Russian (RU): ......Новички в шахматах иногда передвигают короля, не замечая, что загоняют его в шах.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Às vezes, iniciantes no xadrez movem seu rei ao xeque sem nem perceberem.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……國際象棋的初學者，有時是會粗心大意，沒注意到對方的視線，就將國王放到那一格的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……国际象棋的初学者，有时是会粗心大意，没注意到对方的视线，就将国王放到那一格的。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Talvolta i principianti negli scacchi muovono il loro re in scacco senza accorgersene.

Steam (ST): One might mercilessly capture the king in this situation, ...but high-level players are supposed to calmly tell their opponent about their mistake.
Umineko Project (UP): One might mercilessly capture the king in such a situation, ......but high‐level players are supposed to calmly warn beginners about their mistake.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): One might mercilessly capture the king in this situation, ......but high-level players are supposed to calmly tell their opponent about their mistake.
PC Japanese (JP): それを容赦なく取っても良いが、……上級者はそれをさり気なく教えてやるべきだ。
Russian (RU): В такой ситуации можно безжалостно захватить короля...... но игроки высокого уровня должны спокойно сказать противнику об ошибке.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Um adversário impiedoso capturaria o rei em tal situação, ......mas jogadores de alto nível supostamente devem calmamente alertar iniciantes sobre seus erros.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然可以毫不留情地吃掉送上門的國王，……但高手應當，先不動聲色地發出警告。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然可以毫不留情地吃掉送上门的国王，……但高手应当，先不动声色地发出警告。

Umineko Project (UP): "I get it. That's enough. .........You guys can take it in turns to run the reception desk."

Original Witch Hunt (OG): Lion's head tilted to the side in bafflement at this strange gesture.

Russian (RU): Лион наклоняет голову в замешательстве от странного жеста.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Lion inclinou a cabeça para o lado, em perplexidade, diante daquele gesto estranho.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 把這手伸給我看有什麼意義呢？理御不禁納起了悶。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 把这手伸给我看有什么意义呢？理御不禁纳起了闷。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Lion piegò la testa di lato non riuscendo a spiegarsi questo strano gesto.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Lion
Steam (ST): "Good work. ...Umm, ...wait, your name was..."
Umineko Project (UP): "Good work. ......Umm, ......your name was......"
PC Japanese (JP): 「ご苦労様です。……えぇと、……君の名前は確か……。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「ご苦労様です。……えぇと、……君の名前は確か……」
Russian (RU): "Хорошая работа. ......Э‐э, ...подожди, тебя звали......"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Bom trabalho. ......Bem, ......o seu nome era......"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「辛苦了。……那個，……你的名字好像是叫……」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「辛苦了。……那个，……你的名字好像是叫……」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Ottimo lavoro. ... Umm... aspetta, il tuo nome era..."

Speaker: Shannon
Steam (ST): "It's Shannon."
Umineko Project (UP): "It's Shannon."
PC Japanese (JP): 「紗音です。」
Russian (RU): "Шаннон."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "É Shannon."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「我叫紗音。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「我叫纱音。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Shannon."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Lion
Steam (ST): "That's right, Shannon. Please take over at the reception desk. And make sure you keep warm."
Umineko Project (UP): "That's right, Shannon. Please continue manning the reception desk. Make sure you keep warm."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "That's right, Shannon. Please take over the reception desk. Make sure you keep warm."
PC Japanese (JP): 「そうだった、紗音でしたね。引き続き、受付をよろしく頼みます。肩を冷やさないように。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「そうだった、紗音でしたね。引き続き、受付をよろしく頼みます。肩を冷やさないように」
Russian (RU): "Точно, Шаннон. Займи место за приёмной стойкой. Смотри не замёрзни."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Isso mesmo, Shannon. Por favor, continue cuidando da recepção. Trate de se manter aquecida."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「對了，是紗音呢。拜託請繼續負責接待。小心，不要讓肩膀著涼了。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「对了，是纱音呢。拜托请继续负责接待。小心，不要让肩膀着凉了。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Giusto, Shannon. Per favore prenditi cura della reception. Assicurati di rimanere al caldo."

Speaker: Shannon
Steam (ST): "Thank you very much, Lion-sama."
Umineko Project (UP): "Thank you very much, Lion‐sama."
PC Japanese (JP): 「ありがとうございます、理御さま。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「ありがとうございます、理御さま」
Russian (RU): "Большое спасибо."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Muito obrigada, Lion‐sama."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「非常感謝，理御少主。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「非常感谢，理御少主。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Grazie mille, Lion-sama."

Steam (ST): Shannon bowed deeply in response to Lion's kind words.
Umineko Project (UP): Shannon bowed deeply in response to Lion's kind words.
PC Japanese (JP): 理御の気遣いに、深々と頭を下げる紗音。
Russian (RU): Шаннон низко поклонилась в ответ на мягкие слова.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Shannon curvou‐se profundamente em resposta às gentis palavras de Lion.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 聽了理御的關切之言，紗音深深一鞠躬。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 听了理御的关切之言，纱音深深一鞠躬。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Shannon si inchinò in risposta alle parole gentili di Lion.

Steam (ST): There was not even a trace of tension in her manner...
Umineko Project (UP): There was not even a trace of tension in her manner...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): There was not even a trace of tension in her manner...
PC Japanese (JP): そこには、先ほどの緊張感など、微塵ほどもなかった…。
Russian (RU): В её поведении не было ни следа напряжённости...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Não havia nenhum traço de tensão em seu gesto...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 先前的緊張感，在此處已一點都沒有了…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 先前的紧张感，在此处已一点都没有了…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Non c'era la minima traccia di tensione nei suoi gesti...

Speaker: Ushiromiya Lion
Steam (ST): "Let's go, Will. You don't want to miss this chance. ...The Head's mood changes quicker than the autumn sky."
Umineko Project (UP): "Let's go, Will. You won't want to miss your chance. ......The head's mood changes quicker than the autumn sky."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Let's go, Will. Wouldn't want to miss this chance. ......The Head's mood changes quicker than the autumn sky."
PC Japanese (JP): 「参りましょう、ウィル。せっかく時間を頂けたのです。……当主様の機嫌は、秋の空より変わりやすいですよ？」
Russian (RU): "Пойдём, Уилл. Не хотелось бы упустить шанс. ......Настроение главы меняется быстрее осеннего неба."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Vamos indo, Will. Não vai querer perder a sua chance. ......O humor do chefe muda tão rápido quanto o céu de outono."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「走吧，威爾。好不容易才幫您懇請到面會的時間。……當主大人的心情，可是比秋天的天空都要易變哦？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「走吧，威尔。好不容易才帮您恳请到面会的时间。……当主大人的心情，可是比秋天的天空都要易变哦？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Andiamo, Will. Non vorrai sprecare quest'occasione. ... L'umore del capofamiglia cambia più rapidamente del tempo in autunno."
